definition: (of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Media Tek and MStar Semiconductor initially launched the price war.
sentences.chinese: 聯發科和晨星半導體最早開打。

sentences.english: But the US Open tennis tournament is still set to open in New York on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 但是美國網球公開賽仍然計劃在週一在紐約開打。

sentences.english: After war began , the two countries broke off diplomatic relations.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭一旦正式開打，兩國就中止了外交關係。

sentences.english: Let us take the law of our sides; let them begin.
sentences.chinese: 先得找點碴兒讓我們這邊得理，然後就開打。

sentences.english: In other words, it's a product of waiting around for the playoffs to start.
sentences.chinese: 言外之意，這就是說他們只是在坐等季後賽開打。

sentences.english: The two boxers squared off at the center of the ring.
sentences.chinese: 兩名拳擊手於拳擊場中央準備開打。

sentences.english: You're going to have your war anyway.
sentences.chinese: 反正無論如何這個戰你一定要開打。

definition: to start a war/to make war/to battle against
to do battle (with sb)
war/to wage war
confrontation/contest/showdown
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to blockade/to surround/to hem in
second round (of match, or election)
debate/argument/to argue over/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to announce/to read (the news)
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
on-the-spot live broadcast
election campaign
prepared against war/to prepare for war/warmongering
to beat the gong to open a performance
